channel.title: Time Lapse - Making of Alien Dude
channel.description:
Decided to film me sculpting this: [img]http://fc07.deviantart.net/fs51/f/2009/332/4/b/Alien_by_Frell262.png[/img]
40 minutes speed up to 4 minutes:
http://vimeo.com/7869064
Have fun (?)
Note: i started with an extremely simple head in C4D.

kinda reminds me of dragonball z!

l was gonna say that about the second one haha

just curious frell, i dont have any experience in 3d gfx, but are you planning on adding some color to it and maybe add more detail to the eyes ;o

item.title: Time Lapse - Making of Alien Dude
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:8, topic:316983”]You do know that if you hold down shift to smooth, you can change the ZIntensity for the smoothing, the ZI for the standard brush and the shift-smooth are not connected.

I’m not sure if you pick the actual smooth brush and change the ZI if it’ll change the ZI for the shift-smooth.[/quote]
I know, but since its so low poly it does it way to much no matter what. Not to mention its hard to see what its doing.

Read full topic
item.source: Time Lapse - Making of Alien Dude

item.title: Time Lapse - Making of Alien Dude
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

You do know that if you hold down shift to smooth, you can change the ZIntensity for the smoothing, the ZI for the standard brush and the shift-smooth are not connected.

I’m not sure if you pick the actual smooth brush and change the ZI if it’ll change the ZI for the shift-smooth.

Read full topic
item.source: Time Lapse - Making of Alien Dude

item.title: Time Lapse - Making of Alien Dude
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:4, topic:316983”]Personally, I think it’s a little too simple, too symmetrical, mouth needs tons more work, where his brain (?) is should have harder edges, and the way his jaw is smushed back and his cheek structure makes him look less menacing and more like a fatass gone wrong.

Although I like your workflow. Particularly how you use the brushes. In the first half what brushes are you using? Is it just the standard with a shit ton of intensity? It almost looks like you’re using the Sketch brush but you’re not in Sketch mode.[/quote]
I keep looking back at it and agree with you, i also need more closer detail on the skin which im not sure how exactly ill go about.

I use the standard brush at the beginning while its pretty low poly and it brings it out nice but smooths way to much, so i draw on where hunks of meat will be then divide it once and start smoothing there.

This is one i did yesterday:

eclipse245:

Really cool. Looks like it’s coming along great, can’t wait to see the final textured image. Or are you not going to texture?

Im just practicing modeling not really texturing.

SomethingToHide:

PS when you drew in the brain I kinda felt like throwing up O_o

Haha odd. But i did smooth a little too much around it but i also kept in mind that blood would be coming up a little bit (whether it be purple or blue :P). So the blood kinda sticking a little bit could make up for the smoothed skull edge.

Read full topic

item.title: Time Lapse - Making of Alien Dude
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Personally, I think it’s a little too simple, too symmetrical, mouth needs tons more work, where his brain (?) is should have harder edges, and the way his jaw is smushed back and his cheek structure makes him look less menacing and more like a fatass gone wrong.

Although I like your workflow. Particularly how you use the brushes. In the first half what brushes are you using? Is it just the standard with a shit ton of intensity? It almost looks like you’re using the Sketch brush but you’re not in Sketch mode.

Read full topic
